text: hi my name is saya damud a senior
solutions architect at aws
in this video i'll show you how to
configure security settings for your aws
manage microsoft ad directory
aws manage microsoft ad lets you run
microsoft active directory as a managed
service now you have the flexibility to
configure the security settings as you
need to meet compliance requirements and
ensure application compatibility without
increasing any operational workload
this is great for customers who have to
meet security compliance or have to
ensure their applications have the
appropriate security configurations
available to them in the directory you
can update the secure channel
configuration for protocols and ciphers
used within your directories
meet security compliance by disabling
legacy ciphers such as rc4 and des and
protocols such as ssl 2.0 and 3.0 and
tls 1.0 and 1.1
all configurations are deployed to all
domain controllers in your directories
and maintained as you scale out or
extend to additional aws regions
in this demo i will configure an aws
managed microsoft ad directory to meet
security compliance by disabling legacy
ssl and tls protocols
to configure your security settings for
your aws managed microsoft id you want
to log into your aws management console
and access your directory service here's
my directory that i want to modify
you'll now see a directory settings pane
when you scroll down
here's where you'll see the current
protocol and cipher settings for your
directory if you want to change them you
can simply click on edit settings
and here you'll get an option to enable
or disable any settings that you like as
i mentioned earlier i'm going to disable
legacy protocols in particular ssl 2.0
ssl 3.0 tls 1.1 and tls 1.0 so i simply
click on the drop down and change it
from enable to disabled
and you'll notice that the status
changes from default to ready to update
i'll click on review
and i can review my changes and again
you'll see the new value that's going to
be changed from enable to disabled
i'm going to click on update settings
now that i've submitted the changes a
banner shows me that the directory
settings are being updated
after refreshing the console we see the
directories under maintenance while in
maintenance directory functionality will
be limited
we can also scroll down to see the
changes that we applied to the ssl and
tls protocols the status has now changed
from default to updating and includes a
timestamp as to when these changes were
applied let's come back after the
changes are completed
the changes have been completed the ssl
and tls protocols are now disabled
allowing my directory to meet security
compliance
using the console i can search for other
protocols and ciphers to see their
current configuration status if i want
to see what aes cipher is set to i can
search for it right here
i can also search by type so if i can
click on the drop down menu i can search
for all protocols
as well as ciphers
and finally i can filter by status here
i can see all of the updated protocols
thank you
